thread.title: Married At First Sight twin: 'Things don't always happen the way you see them'
thread.title_full: Married At First Sight twin: 'Things don't always happen the way you see them'

author: Fleur Mealing
title: Married At First Sight twin: 'Things don't always happen the way you see them'
text:
* The science behind Married at First Sight 
Why did you decide to do Married At First Sight ? 
First of all I thought why the hell not, I have got nothing to lose and I can only gain something from this. 
I have had two long-term relationships in the past, a six-year and a seven-year which I have taken amazing memories from and we are still good friends today. 
But I feel like this opportunity presented itself and I had been single at that point and I thought I'm obviously not doing something quite right with my judgement so why not put all my faith in the experts and let them try and come up with a compatible match. 
Was it the same logic for Sharon? Ad Feedback 
I guess it was, she was engaged and that ended abruptly. My mum and her used to watch the show and they really enjoyed it. 
Mum actually sent Sharon an email saying why don't you perhaps give this a go and Sharon thought it was pretty crazy at first. 
Then the next day she did the one minute video online and got through the gruelling 3 or 4 months worth of interviews and auditions and once she got to the face-to-face interview they realised that she was a twin and they asked is she single and looking for love. 
The answer was yes and yes and I chimed in. 
Would you describe yourselves as unlucky in love? 
I definitely would not describe myself as unlucky in love. I have had some very loving relationships in the past, it just so happened to be that I was single at the time. 
I guess when the opportunity presents itself for experts in love and relationships to help you find someone compatible, it is too good to pass up. 
Have you always done everything together? 
We do a lot of things together because obviously we have grown up in sync our whole lives. 
Our first steps, our first words, our first day of school and the same friends because we were in the same classes in a country school so we have done a lot together. 
But to get married on the same day is a pretty unique and unusual circumstance. It was even kiss the bride at the same time! A post shared by Mish (@mishmarsh) on Aug 20, 2016 at 9:11pm PDT 
Tell me about the experience itself 
It was awesome, it was an amazing day. We could not have it planned better and we only had three weeks to plan and organise this wedding. 
We chose everything from the flowers, to the location, to our wedding dresses and it all came together so beautifully. There were moments where Sharon and I were looking around at all our family and our friends and our partner's family and friends and they were all getting along and mingling. 
It was an unbelievably magical experience and to have Sharon by my side and vice versa to help support each other was amazing. 
What do your family think of this experience? 
Our family are really supportive. We are a pretty modest easy-going country family. We all live in the city now but our parents have supported us no matter what we have wanted to do in life. 
Whether it was move to the opposite side of the planet or up in the dirt where Sharon went. If we are happy, they are happy. 
What was the most surprising/unexpected part of the process? 
I guess watching the show back. Sometimes things don't always happen the way you see them, there are smoke and mirrors. 
Sometimes there is a look or a conversation and you are like 'I am not sure that actually happened that way, I remember it like this'. 
I guess it is reality tv and you don't have full control over the editing process so you have to keep that in mind when watching the show. 
Moving away from your home town as well. You are in an unfamiliar environment as well as living with a stranger. It's a lot to get used to, it is 24/7 in each others company. Its a shock to the system to try and become comfortable with all these different things 
What was your initial reaction when you saw your husband-to-be? 
Forget the editing process of what you might see on TV because that is not actually what happened. When I first saw Jesse I thought attractive, warm and kind eyes. 
He immediately made me feel calm. I was a little bit nervous and he grabbed my hand and squeezed it and we had a lot of laughs and a lot of banter and it was an extremely fun day no matter what the editing does. 
It is a 12 hour day and they picked up subtle frowns or life-less expressions and they have used that but let me tell you it was a beautiful day. A post shared by Mish (@mishmarsh) on Feb 13, 2017 at 8:13pm PST 
Was it the same for Sharon? 
Absolutely, we both had an amazing day. Honestly when you have got your family and your friends around you and it is a big party and there is so much excitement in the air because you don't know in eight weeks time how you are going to feel. 
Do any of the other matches stand out to you as terrible? 
I would say yes. Scarlett and Michael was not a good match at all. Different values, different personalities. I thought it was a terrible match. 

What has it been like being on TV and opening yourself up to criticism? 
To be very honest, even now I put that in the back of my mind. I'm a pretty reasonable, fair person and I'm not blind to the fact that in world you are always going to have people that disagree with you and don't agree with what you are doing. 
But even the most beautiful, kind people in the world, for example Miranda Kerr, will have people criticising her. 
You are always going to have the haters out there but you just have to get a sense of reality and know that you've got your friends and your family and what they say matters and no one else. - Stuff
